thread.title: Gear review: Smith Optics PivLock Asana Sunglasses
thread.title_full: Gear review: Smith Optics PivLock Asana Sunglasses - San Francisco Chronicle

author: Jill K. Robinson
title: Gear review: Smith Optics PivLock Asana Sunglasses
text:
Photo: Smith Optics The Smith Optics PivLock Asana model is feather-light (all the better to bring along on your adventures) with a minimalist temple design — keeping your performance eyewear simple. The Smith Optics PivLock Asana model is feather-light (all the...
You don’t have to be a gung-ho cyclist or hiker to appreciate some sleek sunglasses. The Smith Optics PivLock Asana model is featherlight (all the better to bring along on your adventures) with a minimalist temple design — keeping your performance eyewear simple. Carbonic TLT lenses are coated to repel water, dirt and grease, because you don’t want to have to keep cleaning your shades. Three lenses are included (colors are based roughly on what frame color you choose), from clear to purple Sol-X mirror. A two-position adjustable nose piece means you can fit the Asanas to your face — whether you prefer up close or farther down your nose, to keep from them from fogging up after a hard-core adventure. The Smith Optics PivLock Asana model is feather-light (all the better to bring along on your adventures) with a minimalist temple design — keeping your performance eyewear simple.
